meanings.definition: Squeeze or press (something) together with a sharp or painful grip.
meanings.sent1: She pinched the clay to make a small bowl.
meanings.sent2: The crab pinched my finger when I tried to pick it up.
meanings.sent3: He pinched his sister's arm playfully during the game.
meanings.sent4: The tight shoes pinched her toes uncomfortably.
meanings.sent5: The chef pinched the herbs between his fingers to release the aroma.

meanings.definition: Feeling or looking strained or tense, especially because of cold or hunger.
meanings.sent1: Her pinched face showed the effects of the harsh winter.
meanings.sent2: The old man's pinched expression revealed his hunger.
meanings.sent3: The pinched look on his face made his friends worry about him.
meanings.sent4: The pinched budget left no room for extra expenses.
meanings.sent5: The pinched cheeks of the child highlighted the lack of food.

meanings.sent1: The squirrel pinched the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent2: She pinched a cookie from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent3: He pinched a pen from his friend's desk as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The pickpocket skillfully pinched wallets in the crowded market.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous cat pinched the toy mouse from the child's hand.
